Pre-Game Insights: Les Hirondelles will head into the game looking to get one over Aliou Cisse’s men and maintain their impressive start to the qualifiers.
Burundi have now gone four consecutive games without defeat, picking up two wins and two draws.
Senegal have now failed to win three of their last four competitive matches — losing once and claiming two draws.
Post-Match Reflections: Tip 2: First to score - Senegal (Senegal have opened the scoring in their last 10 matches)
Tip 3: Over 10.5 corners - No (There have also been fewer than 11 corner kicks in four of Senegal’s last five matches)
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burundi turned in a resilient team display in last Thursday’s Group L curtain-raiser as they secured a 3-2 victory over Malawi at the Bingu National Stadium.
Bumamuru FC midfielder Mokono Eldhino grabbed the headlines as he struck the all-important goal with three minutes left in the game to hand Les Hirondelles an opening-day victory.
Senegal were left red-faced in their group opener on Friday as they were held to a 1-1 draw by Burkina Faso at the Stade Me Abdoulaye Wade.
